intro: Cupania vernalis, commonly known as springcup, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and wetlands. Cupania vernalis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
